This is a major release to which you should upgrade to. This release
makes =
PODAM very fault-taulerant. PODAM will create a POJO no matter
which constr=
uctor type you declared (public no-arg, private no-arg,
public with args, n=
on-public with args).

The difference between 2.3.3 is that while before no=
n-public, non-
default constructors were not covered now they are; addition=
ally while
before in case of non JavaBean standard constuctors PODAM create=
d an
instance but did not populate its attributes, now it both creates an
i=
nstance and populates its attributes.

Regards,

Marco
